ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Hook
ConfigItem.Description: The identifier for a ticket, e.g. Ticket#, Call#, MyTicket#. The default is Ticket#.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::HookDivider
ConfigItem.Description: The divider between TicketHook and ticket number. E.g ': '.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectSize
ConfigItem.Description: Max size of the subjects in an email reply and in some overview screens.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectRe
ConfigItem.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject in an email reply, e.g. RE, AW, or AS.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectFwd
ConfigItem.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject when an email is forwarded, e.g. FW, Fwd, or WG.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectFormat
ConfigItem.Description: The format of the subject. 'Left' means '[TicketHook#:12345] Some Subject', 'Right' means 'Some Subject [TicketHook#:12345]', 'None' means 'Some Subject' and no ticket number. In the latter case you should verify that the setting PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References is activated to recognize followups based on email headers.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::MergeDynamicFields
ConfigItem.Description: A list of dynamic fields that are merged into the main ticket during a merge operation. Only dynamic fields that are empty in the main ticket will be set.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Name of custom queue. The custom queue is a queue selection of your preferred queues and can be selected in the preferences settings.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomService
ConfigItem.Description: Name of custom service. The custom service is a service selection of your preferred services and can be selected in the preferences settings.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NewArticleIgnoreSystemSender
ConfigItem.Description: Ignore system sender article types (e. g. auto responses or email notifications) to be flagged as 'Unread Article' in AgentTicketZoom or expanded automatically in Large view screens.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ChangeOwnerToEveryone
ConfigItem.Description: Changes the owner of tickets to everyone (useful for ASP). Normally only agent with rw permissions in the queue of the ticket will be shown.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Responsible
ConfigItem.Description: Enables ticket responsible feature, to keep track of a specific ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsibleAutoSet
ConfigItem.Description: Automatically sets the owner of a ticket as the responsible for it (if ticket responsible feature is enabled). This will only work by manually actions of the logged in user. It does not work for automated actions e.g. GenericAgent, Postmaster and GenericInterface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Type
ConfigItem.Description: Allows defining new types for ticket (if ticket type feature is enabled).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Type::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket type.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service
ConfigItem.Description: Allows defining services and SLAs for tickets (e. g. email, desktop, network, ...), and escalation attributes for SLAs (if ticket service/SLA feature is enabled).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service::KeepChildren
ConfigItem.Description: Retains all services in listings even if they are children of invalid elements.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service::Default::UnknownCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Allows default services to be selected also for non existing customers.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Activates the ticket archive system to have a faster system by moving some tickets out of the daily scope. To search for these tickets, the archive flag has to be enabled in the ticket search.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveSeenFlags
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if the ticket and article seen flags are removed when a ticket is archived.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveTicketWatchers
ConfigItem.Description: Removes the ticket watcher information when a ticket is archived.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomerArchiveSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Activates the ticket archive system search in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator
ConfigItem.Description: Selects the ticket number generator module. "AutoIncrement" increments the ticket number, the SystemID and the counter are used with SystemID.counter format (e.g. 1010138, 1010139). With "Date" the ticket numbers will be generated by the current date, the SystemID and the counter. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.counter (e.g. 200206231010138, 200206231010139). With "DateChecksum" the counter will be appended as checksum to the string of date and SystemID. The checksum will be rotated on a daily basis. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.Counter.CheckSum (e.g. 2002070110101520, 2002070110101535). "Random" generates randomized ticket numbers in the format "SystemID.Random" (e.g. 100057866352, 103745394596).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::CheckSystemID
ConfigItem.Description: Checks the SystemID in ticket number detection for follow-ups (use "No" if SystemID has been changed after using the system).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::MinCounterSize
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the minimal ticket counter size if "AutoIncrement" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator. Default is 5, this means the counter starts from 10000.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::Date::UseFormattedCounter
ConfigItem.Description: Enables the minimal ticket counter size (if "Date" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CounterLog
ConfigItem.Description: Log file for the ticket counter.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::IndexModule
ConfigItem.Description: IndexAccelerator: to choose your backend TicketViewAccelerator module. "RuntimeDB" generates each queue view on the fly from ticket table (no performance problems up to approx. 60.000 tickets in total and 6.000 open tickets in the system). "StaticDB" is the most powerful module, it uses an extra ticket-index table that works like a view (recommended if more than 80.000 and 6.000 open tickets are stored in the system). Use the command "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::QueueIndexRebuild" for initial index creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StorageModule
ConfigItem.Description: Saves the attachments of articles. "DB" stores all data in the database (not recommended for storing big attachments). "FS" stores the data on the filesystem; this is faster but the webserver should run under the OTRS user. You can switch between the modules even on a system that is already in production without any loss of data. Note: Searching for attachment names is not supported when "FS" is used.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StorageModule::CheckAllBackends
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies whether all storage backends should be checked when looking for attachments. This is only required for installations where some attachments are in the file system, and others in the database.

ConfigItem.Name: ArticleDir
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the directory to store the data in, if "FS" was selected for TicketStorageModule.

ConfigItem.Name: OTRSEscalationEvents::DecayTime
ConfigItem.Description: The duration in minutes after emitting an event, in which the new escalation notify and start events are suppressed.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###100-ArchiveRestore
ConfigItem.Description: Restores a ticket from the archive (only if the event is a state change to any open available state).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###110-AcceleratorUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Updates the ticket index accelerator.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###120-ForceOwnerResetOnMove
ConfigItem.Description: Resets and unlocks the owner of a ticket if it was moved to another queue.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###130-ForceStateChangeOnLock
ConfigItem.Description: Forces to choose a different ticket state (from current) after lock action. Define the current state as key, and the next state after lock action as content.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###140-ResponsibleAutoSet
ConfigItem.Description: Automatically sets the responsible of a ticket (if it is not set yet) after the first owner update.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###150-TicketPendingTimeReset
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the PendingTime of a ticket to 0 if the state is changed to a non-pending state.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###500-NotificationEvent
ConfigItem.Description: Sends the notifications which are configured in the admin interface under "Notfication (Event)".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###910-EscalationIndex
ConfigItem.Description: Updates the ticket escalation index after a ticket attribute got updated.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###920-EscalationStopEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket event module that triggers the escalation stop events.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###930-ForceUnlockOnMove
ConfigItem.Description: Forces to unlock tickets after being moved to another queue.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###940-TicketArticleNewMessageUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Update Ticket "Seen" flag if every article got seen or a new Article got created.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerCompany::EventModulePost###110-UpdateTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Event module that updates tickets after an update of the Customer.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerUser::EventModulePost###120-UpdateTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Event module that updates tickets after an update of the Customer User.

ConfigItem.Name: DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser::Mapping
ConfigItem.Description: Define a mapping between variables of the customer user data (keys) and dynamic fields of a ticket (values). The purpose is to store customer user data in ticket dynamic fields. The dynamic fields must be present in the system and should be enabled for AgentTicketFreeText, so that they can be set/updated manually by the agent. They mustn't be enabled for AgentTicketPhone, AgentTicketEmail and AgentTicketCustomer. If they were, they would have precedence over the automatically set values. To use this mapping, you have to also activate the next setting below.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###950-DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser
ConfigItem.Description: This event module stores attributes from CustomerUser as DynamicFields tickets. Please see the setting above for how to configure the mapping.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###001-CustomModule
ConfigItem.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndexModule
ConfigItem.Description: Helps to extend your articles full-text search (From, To, Cc, Subject and Body search). Runtime will do full-text searches on live data (it works fine for up to 50.000 tickets). StaticDB will strip all articles and will build an index after article creation, increasing fulltext searches about 50%. To create an initial index use "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndexRebuild".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::WarnOnStopWordUsage
ConfigItem.Description: Display a warning and prevent search when using stop words within fulltext search.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Attribute
ConfigItem.Description: Basic fulltext index settings. Execute "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndexRebuild" in order to generate a new index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Filters
ConfigItem.Description: Fulltext index regex filters to remove parts of the text.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###en
ConfigItem.Description: English stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###de
ConfigItem.Description: German stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###nl
ConfigItem.Description: Dutch stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###es
ConfigItem.Description: Spanish stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###fr
ConfigItem.Description: French stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###it
ConfigItem.Description: Italian stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###Custom
ConfigItem.Description: Customizable stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###098-ArticleSearchIndex
ConfigItem.Description: Builds an article index right after the article's creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Small
ConfigItem.Description: Allows having a small format ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also the customer information).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::OverviewSmall###ColumnHeader
ConfigItem.Description: Shows either the last customer article's subject or the ticket title in the small format overview.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Medium
ConfigItem.Description: Allows having a medium format ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also the customer information).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Preview
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a preview of the ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also Customer-Info, CustomerInfoMaxSize max. size in characters of Customer-Info).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewArticleSenderTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which article sender types should be shown in the preview of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewArticleLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the count of articles visible in preview mode of ticket overviews.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewArticleTypeExpanded
ConfigItem.Description: Defines wich article type should be expanded when entering the overview. If nothing defined, latest article will be expanded.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PendingDiffTime
ConfigItem.Description: Time in seconds that gets added to the actual time if setting a pending-state (default: 86400 = 1 day).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::MaxQueueLevel
ConfigItem.Description: Define the max depth of queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ListType
ConfigItem.Description: Shows existing parent/child queue lists in the system in the form of a tree or a list.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Watcher
ConfigItem.Description: Enables or disables the ticket watcher feature, to keep track of tickets without being the owner nor the responsible.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::WatcherGroup
ConfigItem.Description: Enables ticket watcher feature only for the listed groups.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkFeature
ConfigItem.Description: Enables ticket bulk action feature for the agent frontend to work on more than one ticket at a time.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkFeatureGroup
ConfigItem.Description: Enables ticket bulk action feature only for the listed groups.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PlainView
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a link to see a zoomed email ticket in plain text.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomExpand
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all the articles of the ticket (expanded) in the zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomExpandSort
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the articles sorted normally or in reverse, under ticket zoom in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ZoomAttachmentDisplayCount
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a count of icons in the ticket zoom, if the article has attachments.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ZoomTimeDisplay
ConfigItem.Description: Displays the accounted time for an article in the ticket zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::UseArticleColors
ConfigItem.Description: Shows colors for different article types in the article table.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TicketArticleFilter
ConfigItem.Description: Activates the article filter in the zoom view to specify which articles should be shown.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HistoryOrder
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the ticket history (reverse ordered) in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HistoryTypes###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: Controls how to display the ticket history entries as readable values.

Hash.Item: Ticket moved into Queue "%s" (%s) from Queue "%s" (%s).
%s time unit(s) accounted. Now total %s time unit(s).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TextAreaEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Permitted width for compose email windows.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TextAreaNote
ConfigItem.Description: Permitted width for compose note windows.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::InformAgentMaxSize
ConfigItem.Description: Max size (in rows) of the informed agents box in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::InvolvedAgentMaxSize
ConfigItem.Description: Max size (in rows) of the involved agents box in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoCompose
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the customer user information (phone and email) in the compose screen.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoComposeMaxSize
ConfigItem.Description: Max size (in characters) of the customer information table (phone and email) in the compose screen.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoZoom
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the customer user's info in the ticket zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoZoomMaxSize
ConfigItem.Description: Maximum size (in characters) of the customer information table in the ticket zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DynamicFieldsZoomMaxSizeSidebar
ConfigItem.Description: Maximum length (in characters) of the dynamic field in the sidebar of the ticket zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DynamicFieldsZoomMaxSizeArticle
ConfigItem.Description: Maximum length (in characters) of the dynamic field in the article of the ticket zoom view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverviewSortable
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if customers have the ability to sort their tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerDisableCompanyTicketAccess
ConfigItem.Description: This option will deny the access to customer company tickets, which are not created by the customer user.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverviewCustomEmptyText
ConfigItem.Description: Custom text for the page shown to customers that have no tickets yet (if you need those text translated add them to a custom translation module).

Hash.Item: Please click the button below to create your first ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###ColumnHeader
ConfigItem.Description: Shows either the last customer article's subject or the ticket title in the small format overview.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###Owner
ConfigItem.Description: Show the current owner in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###Queue
ConfigItem.Description: Show the current queue in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###DynamicField
ConfigItem.Description: Dynamic fields shown in the ticket overview screen of the customer interface. Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Enabled, 2 = Enabled and required.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###StripEmptyLines
ConfigItem.Description: Strips empty lines on the ticket preview in the queue view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###ViewAllPossibleTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all both ro and rw queues in the queue view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HideEmptyQueues
ConfigItem.Description: Show queues even when only locked tickets are in.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HighlightAge1
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the age in minutes (first level) for highlighting queues that contain untouched tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HighlightAge2
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the age in minutes (second level) for highlighting queues that contain untouched tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###Blink
ConfigItem.Description: Activates a blinking mechanism of the queue that contains the oldest ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###UseSubQueues
ConfigItem.Description: Include tickets of subqueues per default when selecting a queue.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###QueueSort
ConfigItem.Description: Sorts the tickets (ascendingly or descendingly) when a single queue is selected in the queue view and after the tickets are sorted by priority. Values: 0 = ascending (oldest on top, default), 1 = descending (youngest on top). Use the QueueID for the key and 0 or 1 for value.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default sort criteria for all queues displayed in the queue view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###PreSort::ByPriority
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a pre-sorting by priority should be done in the queue view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default sort order for all queues in the queue view, after priority sort.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###StripEmptyLines
ConfigItem.Description: Strips empty lines on the ticket preview in the service view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###ViewAllPossibleTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all both ro and rw tickets in the service view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###ServiceSort
ConfigItem.Description: Sorts the tickets (ascendingly or descendingly) when a single queue is selected in the service view and after the tickets are sorted by priority. Values: 0 = ascending (oldest on top, default), 1 = descending (youngest on top). Use the ServiceID for the key and 0 or 1 for value.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default sort criteria for all services displayed in the service view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###PreSort::ByPriority
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a pre-sorting by priority should be done in the service view.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default sort order for all services in the service view, after priority sort.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AccountTime
ConfigItem.Description: Activates time accounting.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TimeUnits
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the prefered time units (e.g. work units, hours, minutes).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if time accounting is mandatory in the agent interface. If activated, a note must be entered for all ticket actions (no matter if the note itself is configured as active or is originally mandatory for the individual ticket action screen).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkAccountedTime
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if time accounting must be set to all tickets in bulk action.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NeedSpellCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if composed messages have to be spell checked in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###ViewableTicketsPage
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all open tickets (even if they are locked) in the status view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the status view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket order (after priority sort) in the status view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###TicketPermission
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the required permission to show a ticket in the escalation view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###ViewableTicketsPage
ConfigItem.Description: Shows all open tickets (even if they are locked) in the escalation view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the escalation view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket order (after priority sort) in the escalation view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###ExtendedSearchCondition
ConfigItem.Description: Allows extended search conditions in ticket search of the agent interface. With this feature you can search e. g. ticket title with this kind of conditions like "(*key1*&&*key2*)" or "(*key1*||*key2*)".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Maximum number of tickets to be displayed in the result of a search in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchPageShown
ConfigItem.Description: Number of tickets to be displayed in each page of a search result in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchViewableTicketLines
ConfigItem.Description: Number of lines (per ticket) that are shown by the search utility in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting of the ticket search result of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket order in the ticket search result of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchArticleCSVTree
ConfigItem.Description: Exports the whole article tree in search result (it can affect the system performance).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchCSVData

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###ArticleCreateTime
ConfigItem.Description: Includes article create times in the ticket search of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###QueueIDs
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

ConfigItem.Description: Default data to use on attribute for ticket search screen. Example: "TicketCreateTimePointFormat=year;TicketCreateTimePointStart=Last;TicketCreateTimePoint=2;".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketLockedView###SortBy::Default

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketLockedView###Order::Default

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketResponsibleView###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the responsible view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketResponsibleView###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket order in the responsible view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketWatchView###SortBy::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the watch view of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketWatchView###Order::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket order in the watch view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the ticket free text screen in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###TicketType
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the ticket type in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface (Ticket::Type needs to be activated).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Service
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the service in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface (Ticket::Service needs to be activated).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###ServiceMandatory
ConfigItem.Description: Sets if service must be selected by the agent.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###SLAMandatory
ConfigItem.Description: Sets if SLA must be selected by the agent.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Queue
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the queue in the ticket free text screen of a zoomed ticket in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Owner
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the ticket owner in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###OwnerMandatory
ConfigItem.Description: Sets if ticket owner must be selected by the agent.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Responsible
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the responsible agent of the ticket in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###State
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the state of a ticket in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next state of a ticket after adding a note, in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###StateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default next state of a ticket after adding a note, in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Note
ConfigItem.Description: Allows adding notes in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface. Can be overwritten by Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###NoteMandatory
ConfigItem.Description: Sets if note must be filled in by the agent. Can be overwritten by Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Subject
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default subject of a note in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Body
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default body of a note in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###InvolvedAgent
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a list of all the involved agents on this ticket, in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###InformAgent
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a list of all the possible agents (all agents with note permissions on the queue/ticket) to determine who should be informed about this note, in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###ArticleTypeDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default type of the note in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###ArticleTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the available note types for this ticket mask. If the option is deselected, ArticleTypeDefault is used and the option is removed from the mask.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###Priority
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the ticket priority options in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketFreeText###PriorityDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket priority in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines the history comment for the ticket free text screen action, which gets used for ticket history.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NewOwnerSelection
ConfigItem.Description: Shows an owner selection in phone and email tickets in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NewResponsibleSelection
ConfigItem.Description: Show a responsible selection in phone and email tickets in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NewQueueSelectionType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the recipient target of the phone ticket and the sender of the email ticket ("Queue" shows all queues, "System address" displays all system addresses) in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NewQueueSelectionString
ConfigItem.Description: Determines the strings that will be shown as recipient (To:) of the phone ticket and as sender (From:) of the email ticket in the agent interface. For Queue as NewQueueSelectionType "<Queue>" shows the names of the queues and for SystemAddress "<Realname> <<Email>>" shows the name and email of the recipient.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NewQueueOwnSelection
ConfigItem.Description: Determines which options will be valid of the recipient (phone ticket) and the sender (email ticket) in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ShowCustomerTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Shows customer history tickets in AgentTicketPhone, AgentTicketEmail and AgentTicketCustomer.

ConfigItem.Name: NewTicketInNewWindow::Enabled
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled, TicketPhone and TicketEmail will be open in new windows.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::MoveType
ConfigItem.Description: Determines if the list of possible queues to move to ticket into should be displayed in a dropdown list or in a new window in the agent interface. If "New Window" is set you can add a move note to the ticket.

ConfigItem.Description: Automatically lock and set owner to current Agent after opening the move ticket screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMove###State
ConfigItem.Description: Allows to set a new ticket state in the move ticket screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMove###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next state of a ticket after being moved to another queue, in the move ticket screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMove###Priority
ConfigItem.Description: Shows the ticket priority options in the move ticket screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMove###Note
ConfigItem.Description: Allows adding notes in the ticket free text screen of the agent interface. Can be overwritten by Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMove###NoteMandatory
ConfigItem.Description: Sets if note must be filled in by the agent. Can be overwritten by Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketBounce###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the ticket bounce screen in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketBounce###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the ticket bounce screen of the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketBounce###StateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default next state of a ticket after being bounced, in the ticket bounce screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketBounce###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next state of a ticket after being bounced, in the ticket bounce screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BounceText
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket bounced notification for customer/sender in the ticket bounce screen of the agent interface.

Setting.TextArea: Your email with ticket number "<OTRS_TICKET>" is bounced to "<OTRS_BOUNCE_TO>". Contact this address for further information.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the ticket compose screen in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###StateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default next state of a ticket if it is composed / answered in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next possible states after composing / answering a ticket in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###ArticleTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the different article types that will be used in the system.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###DefaultArticleType
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the default article type for the ticket compose screen in the agent interface if the article type cannot be automatically detected.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the format of responses in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface ([% Data.OrigFrom | html %] is From 1:1, [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] is only realname of From).

Setting.TextArea:
[% Data.Salutation | html %] [% Data.StdResponse | html %] [% Data.Signature | html %]
[% Data.Created | Localize("TimeShort") %] - [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] [% Translate("wrote") | html %]: [% Data.Body | html %]

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Quote
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the used character for plaintext email quotes in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface. If this is empty or inactive, original emails will not be quoted but appended to the response.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseQuoteMaxLines
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximum number of quoted lines to be added to responses.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ComposeAddCustomerAddress
ConfigItem.Description: Adds customers email addresses to recipients in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface. The customers email address won't be added if the article type is email-internal.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ComposeReplaceSenderAddress
ConfigItem.Description: Replaces the original sender with current customer's email address on compose answer in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ComposeExcludeCcRecipients
ConfigItem.Description: Uses Cc recipients in reply Cc list on compose an email answer in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the ticket forward screen in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the ticket forward screen of the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###StateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default next state of a ticket after being forwarded, in the ticket forward screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next possible states after forwarding a ticket in the ticket forward screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###ArticleTypeDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default type of forwarded message in the ticket forward screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketForward###ArticleTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the different article types that will be used in the system.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the email outbound screen in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the email outbound screen of the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###StateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default next state of a ticket after the message has been sent, in the email outbound screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###StateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the next possible states after sending a message in the email outbound screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###ArticleTypeDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default type of the message in the email outbound screen of the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmailOutbound###ArticleTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the different article types that will be used in the system.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMerge###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to use the ticket merge screen of a zoomed ticket in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketMerge###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required in the ticket merge screen of a zoomed ticket in the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCustomer###Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Required permissions to change the customer of a ticket in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCustomer###RequiredLock
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if a ticket lock is required to change the customer of a ticket in the agent interface (if the ticket isn't locked yet, the ticket gets locked and the current agent will be set automatically as its owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCustomer::CustomerIDReadOnly
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if CustomerID is read-only in the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::MergeText
ConfigItem.Description: When tickets are merged, the customer can be informed per email by setting the check box "Inform Sender". In this text area, you can define a pre-formatted text which can later be modified by the agents.

Setting.TextArea: Your email with ticket number "<OTRS_TICKET>" is merged to "<OTRS_MERGE_TO_TICKET>".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeSubject
ConfigItem.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the subject of this note (this subject cannot be changed by the agent).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeText
ConfigItem.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the body of this note (this text cannot be changed by the agent).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableSenderTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default viewable sender types of a ticket (default: customer).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableLocks
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the viewable locks of a ticket. NOTE: When you change this setting, make sure to delete the cache in order to use the new value. Default: unlock, tmp_lock.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the valid state types for a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::UnlockStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the valid states for unlocked tickets. To unlock tickets the script "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::UnlockTimeout" can be used.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingNotificationOnlyToOwner
ConfigItem.Description: Sends reminder notifications of unlocked ticket after reaching the reminder date (only sent to ticket owner).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingNotificationNotToResponsible
ConfigItem.Description: Disables sending reminder notifications to the responsible agent of a ticket (Ticket::Responsible needs to be activated).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingReminderStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state type of the reminder for pending tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingAutoStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Determines the possible states for pending tickets that changed state after reaching time limit.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StateAfterPending
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which states should be set automatically (Content), after the pending time of state (Key) has been reached.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerDBLink
ConfigItem.Description: Defines an external link to the database of the customer (e.g. 'http://yourhost/customer.php?CID=[% Data.CustomerID %]' or '').

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerDBLinkTarget
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the target attribute in the link to external customer database. E.g. 'target="cdb"'.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerDBLinkClass
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the target attribute in the link to external customer database. E.g. 'AsPopup PopupType_TicketAction'.

ConfigItem.Name: System::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Standard available permissions for agents within the application. If more permissions are needed, they can be entered here. Permissions must be defined to be effective. Some other good permissions have also been provided built-in: note, close, pending, customer, freetext, move, compose, responsible, forward, and bounce. Make sure that "rw" is always the last registered permission.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###1-OwnerCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the owner of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::OwnerCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the OwnerCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###2-ResponsibleCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the agent responsible of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::ResponsibleCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the ResponsibleCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###3-GroupCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to check the group permissions for the access to tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###4-WatcherCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the watcher agents of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###5-CreatorCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the creator of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::CreatorCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the CreatorCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###6-InvolvedCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to any agent that has been involved in a ticket in the past (based on ticket history entries).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::InvolvedCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the InvolvedCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###1-GroupCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to check the group permissions for customer access to tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###2-CustomerUserIDCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerUserID of the ticket matches the CustomerUserID of the customer.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###3-CustomerIDCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerID of the ticket matches the CustomerID of the customer.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFrom
ConfigItem.Description: Defines how the From field from the emails (sent from answers and email tickets) should look like.

Option.Item: Agent Name + FromSeparator + System Address Display Name

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFromSeparator
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the separator between the agents real name and the given queue email address.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0100-TicketPendingReminder
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket pending reminder overview of the agent interface . "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns. Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Available, 2 = Enabled by default.

Hash.Item: All tickets with a reminder set where the reminder date has been reached

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0110-TicketEscalation
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket escalation overview of the agent interface . "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns. Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Available, 2 = Enabled by default.

"CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns. Hash.Item: All new tickets, these tickets have not been worked on yet

All open tickets, these tickets have already been worked on, but need a response

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0250-TicketStats
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket stats of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0260-TicketCalendar
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the upcoming events widget of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0270-TicketQueueOverview
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the queue overview widget of the agent interface. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "QueuePermissionGroup" is not mandatory, queues are only listed if they belong to this permission group if you enable it. "States" is a list of states, the key is the sort order of the state in the widget. "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin.

Hash.Item: Provides a matrix overview of the tickets per state per queue.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardBackend###0280-DashboardEventsTicketCalendar
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket events calendar of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar###CalendarWidth
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the calendar width in percent. Default is 95%.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar###Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Defines queues that's tickets are used for displaying as calendar events.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldStartTime
ConfigItem.Description: Define dynamic field name for start time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldEndTime
ConfigItem.Description: Define dynamic field name for end time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldsForEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the dynamic fields that are used for displaying on calendar events.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::TicketFieldsForEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the ticket fields that are going to be displayed calendar events. The "Key" defines the field or ticket attribute and the "Content" defines the display name.

ConfigItem.Name: OnlyValuesOnTicket
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if the values for filters should be retrieved from all available tickets. If set to "Yes", only values which are actually used in any ticket will be available for filtering. Please note: The list of customers will always be retrieved like this.

ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default priority of new tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterDefaultState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default state of new tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterFollowUpState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterFollowUpStateClosed
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up and the ticket was already closed.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterFollowUpOnUnlockAgentNotifyOnlyToOwner
ConfigItem.Description: Sends agent follow-up notification only to the owner, if a ticket is unlocked (the default is to send the notification to all agents).

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterHeaderFieldCount
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the number of header fields in frontend modules for add and update postmaster filters. It can be up to 99 fields.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterX-Header
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the X-headers that should be scanned.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###1-Match
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Block/ignore all spam email with From: noreply@ address.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###2-Match
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Get a 4 digit number to ticket free text, use regex in Match e. g. From => '(.+?)@.+?', and use () as [***] in Set =>.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###3-NewTicketReject
ConfigItem.Description: Blocks all the incoming emails that do not have a valid ticket number in subject with From: @example.com address.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Sender
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the sender for rejected emails.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Subject
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for rejected emails.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Body
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for rejected emails.

Setting.TextArea:
Dear Customer,
Unfortunately we could not detect a valid ticket number in your subject, so this email can't be processed.
Please create a new ticket via the customer panel.
Thanks for your help!
Your Helpdesk Team

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###4-CMD
ConfigItem.Description: CMD example setup. Ignores emails where external CMD returns some output on STDOUT (email will be piped into STDIN of some.bin).

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###5-SpamAssassin
ConfigItem.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Ignores emails that are marked with SpamAssassin.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###6-SpamAssassin
ConfigItem.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Moves marked mails to spam queue.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-MatchDBSource
ConfigItem.Description: Module to use database filter storage.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreCreateFilterModule###000-FollowUpArticleTypeCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to check if arrived emails should be marked as email-internal (because of original forwarded internal email). ArticleType and SenderType define the values for the arrived email/article.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition1
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition2
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition3
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition4
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-DecryptBody
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter encrypted bodies of incoming messages.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-SMIMEFetchFromCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Module to fetch customer users SMIME certificates of incoming messages.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0100-Subject
ConfigItem.Description: Checks if an E-Mail is a followup to an existing ticket by searching the subject for a valid ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on In-Reply-To or References headers for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0300-Body
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on email body for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0400-Attachments
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on attachment contents for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0500-RawEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on the raw source email for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::NewTicket::AutoAssignCustomerIDForUnknownCustomers
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if CustomerID is automatically copied from the sender address for unknown customers.

ConfigItem.Name: SendNoAutoResponseRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: If this regex matches, no message will be send by the autoresponder.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoResponseForWebTickets
ConfigItem.Description: If this option is set to 'Yes', tickets created via the web interface, via Customers or Agents, will receive an autoresponse if configured. If this option is set to 'No', no autoresponses will be sent.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0200
ConfigItem.Description: Links 2 tickets with a "Normal" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0201
ConfigItem.Description: Links 2 tickets with a "ParentChild" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::IgnoreLinkedTicketStateTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines, which tickets of which ticket state types should not be listed in linked ticket lists.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###DynamicField
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen. Example: "Key" must have the name of the Dynamic Field in this case 'X', "Content" must have the value of the Dynamic Field depending on the Dynamic Field type, Text: 'a text', Dropdown: '1', Date/Time: 'Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartYear=1974; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartMonth=01; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartDay=26; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartHour=00; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartMinute=00; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStartSecond=00; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopYear=2013; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopMonth=01; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopDay=26; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopHour=23; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopMinute=59; Search_DynamicField_XTimeSlotStopSecond=59;' and or 'Search_DynamicField_XTimePointFormat=week; Search_DynamicField_XTimePointStart=Before; Search_DynamicField_XTimePointValue=7';.

ConfigItem.Name: StandardTemplate::Types
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the list of types for templates.

ConfigItem.Name: StandardTemplate2QueueByCreating
ConfigItem.Description: List of default Standard Templates which are assigned automatically to new Queues upon creation.

ConfigItem.Name: DefaultOverviewColumns
ConfigItem.Description: General ticket data shown in the ticket overviews (fall-back). Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Available, 2 = Enabled by default. Note that TicketNumber can not be disabled, because it is necessary.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###DefaultColumns
ConfigItem.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the status view of the agent interface. Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Available, 2 = Enabled by default. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

ConfigItem.Name: Frontend::NavBarModule###7-AgentTicketService
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration (disable AgentTicketService link if Ticket Serivice feature is not used).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DefaultRecipientDisplayType
ConfigItem.Description: Default display type for recipient (To,Cc) names in AgentTicketZoom and CustomerTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DefaultSenderDisplayType
ConfigItem.Description: Default display type for sender (From) names in AgentTicketZoom and CustomerTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::ComplexTable::SettingsVisibility###Ticket
ConfigItem.Description: Define Actions where a settings button is available in the linked objects widget (LinkObject::ViewMode = "complex"). Please note that these Actions must have registered the following JS and CSS files: Core.AllocationList.css, Core.UI.AllocationList.js, Core.UI.Table.Sort.js, Core.Agent.TableFilters.js.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::ComplexTable###Ticket
ConfigItem.Description: Define which columns are shown in the linked tickets widget (LinkObject::ViewMode = "complex"). Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns. Possible settings: 0 = Disabled, 1 = Available, 2 = Enabled by default.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMeta
ConfigItem.Description: Whether or not to collect meta information from articles using filters configured in Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters###CVE-Mitre
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter to collect CVE numbers from article texts in AgentTicketZoom. The results will be displayed in a meta box next to the article. Fill in URLPreview if you would like to see a preview when moving your mouse cursor above the link element. This could be the same URL as in URL, but also an alternate one. Please note that some websites deny being displayed within an iframe (e.g. Google) and thus won't work with the preview mode.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters###CVE-Google
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a filter to collect CVE numbers from article texts in AgentTicketZoom. The results will be displayed in a meta box next to the article. Fill in URLPreview if you would like to see a preview when moving your mouse cursor above the link element. This could be the same URL as in URL, but also an alternate one. Please note that some websites deny being displayed within an iframe (e.g. Google) and thus won't work with the preview mode.
